sen.j: 中臣 意美麻呂（なかとみ の おみまろ、生年不詳 － 和銅4年6月22日 (旧暦)（711年8月10日））は、奈良時代の官人。
sen.e: NAKATOMI no Omimaro (date of birth and death unknown) was a government official in the Nara Period.
NAKATOMI no Omimaro (date of birth unknown - August 10, 711) was a government official in the Nara Period.
sen.cmt: ・(date of birth and death unknown)→(date of birth unknown - August 10, 711)
sen.e: NAKATOMI no Omimaro (date of birth unknown - August 10, 711) was a government official in the Nara Period.
His father was FUJIWARA no Kunitari.
His father was FUJIWARA no Kunitari.
His father was FUJIWARA no Kunitari.

sen.j: 叔父藤原鎌足の娘を娶って婿養子となり、鎌足の実子である藤原不比等が成人するまで藤原氏の氏上であったといわれている。
sen.e: He married his Uncle FUJIWARA no Kamatari's daughter and adopted by his wife's family and thus became the head of Fujiwara clan until his biological son, FUJIWARA no Fuhito became an adult.

It is said that he married his Uncle, FUJIWARA no Kamatari's daughter and was adopted by his wife's family and then became the head of Fujiwara clan until Kamatari's biological son, FUJIWARA no Fuhito became an adult.
sen.cmt: ・「It is said that」を追加しました。 ・and adopted→and was adopted・and thus→and then・his biological son→Kamatari's biological son
sen.e: It is said that he married his Uncle, FUJIWARA no Kamatari's daughter and was adopted by his wife's family and then became the head of Fujiwara clan until Kamatari's biological son, FUJIWARA no Fuhito became an adult.

sen.j: 後に神事に供するため藤原朝臣から旧姓の中臣氏に復し、以後中臣朝臣を称した。
sen.e: He was addressed as NAKATOMI no Asomi after changing his last name from FUJIWARA no Asomi to his old name, NAKATOMI, in order to dedicate himself to religious activities.
He was addressed as NAKATOMI no Asomi after changing his last name from FUJIWARA no Asomi to his old name, NAKATOMI, in order to dedicate himself to religious activities.
He was addressed as NAKATOMI no Asomi after changing his last name from FUJIWARA no Asomi to his old name, NAKATOMI, in order to dedicate himself to religious activities.

sen.j: 名は臣万呂・臣麻呂とも書く。
sen.e: His name is also spelled as 臣万呂 and 臣麻呂.
His name, Omimaro was written in different Chinese characters.
sen.cmt: His name is also spelled as 臣万呂 and 臣麻呂.→His name, Omimaro was written in different Chinese characters.
sen.e: His name, Omimaro was written in different Chinese characters.

sen.j: 子に中臣東人・大中臣清麻呂（大中臣氏の祖）がいる。
sen.e: His children included NAKATOMI no Azumahito and ONAKATOMI no Kiyomaro (the progenitor of the Onakatomi clan).
His children included NAKATOMI no Azumahito and ONAKATOMI no Kiyomaro (the progenitor of the Onakatomi clan).
His children included NAKATOMI no Azumahito and ONAKATOMI no Kiyomaro (the progenitor of the Onakatomi clan).

sen.j: 朱鳥元年（686年）大津皇子の謀反に連座し、捕らえられたが後放免された。
sen.e: In 686, he was arrested for taking a part in the Prince Otsu's rebellion but later released.
In 686, he was captureed for taking a part in the Prince Otsu's rebellion but released later.
In 686, he was captureed for taking a part in the Prince Otsu's rebellion but released later.

sen.j: このとき官職は大舎人であった。
sen.e: His position at that time was Otoneri (Royal Attendant).
His position at that time was Otoneri (Royal Attendant).
His position at that time was Otoneri (Royal Attendant).

sen.j: 文武天皇3年（699年）鋳銭司長官、慶雲2年（705年）左大弁、和銅元年（708年）神祇官・中納言にそれぞれ任じられた。
sen.e: He was promoted to Jyusenshi no Kami (a director of the Mint) in 699, and to Sadaiben (Controller of the Left) in 708, and to Jingikan (officer of the institution for dedicating to religeous ceremony) and Chunagon (Minor Councillor) in 708.

He was promoted to Jyusenshi no Kami (a director of the Mint) in 699, and to Sadaiben (Controller of the Left) in 705, and to Jingikan (officer of the institution for dedicating to religeous ceremony) and Chunagon (Minor Councillor) in 708.
sen.cmt: (Controller of the Left) in 708→and to Sadaiben (Controller of the Left) in 705
sen.e: He was promoted to Jyusenshi no Kami (a director of the Mint) in 699, and to Sadaiben (Controller of the Left) in 705, and to Jingikan (officer of the institution for dedicating to religeous ceremony) and Chunagon (Minor Councillor) in 708.

sen.j: 和銅4年（711年）4月7日に正四位上に叙せられたが、同年閏6月22日に死去。
sen.e: On April 7, 711, He received the title of Shoshinojo (Senior Forth Rank, Upper Grade); however, he died on June 22 of the same year.
On April 7, 711, He received the title of Shoshinojo (Senior Forth Rank, Upper Grade); however, he died on August 10 of the same year.
sen.cmt: he died on June 22→he died on August 10（「june 22（6月22日）」は、和銅4年の月日で、西暦711年では一致していません。）（セルB4参照）
sen.e: On April 7, 711, He received the title of Shoshinojo (Senior Forth Rank, Upper Grade); however, he died on August 10 of the same year.

sen.j: 出雲風土記に猪麻呂(いのまろ)という神官の話が出てくるが、これと意美麻呂(いみまろ)と同一人物という説がある。
sen.e: There is a priest named I no Maro in the Izumonokuni Fudoki, and he is thought to be the same person as Imimaro.
There is a priest named I no Maro in the Izumonokuni Fudoki, and he is thought to be the same person as Imimaro.
There is a priest named I no Maro in the Izumonokuni Fudoki, and he is thought to be the same person as Imimaro.
